sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: Calculate the coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump that operates at a temperature difference of 20Â°C and has a heating capacity of 10 kW, when the electric power consumed by the heat pump is 2.5 kW.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is the ratio of the heating capacity (Q) to the electric power consumed (W) by the heat pump. Mathematically, it can be represented as:

COP = Q / W

Given the heating capacity (Q) is 10 kW and the electric power consumed (W) is 2.5 kW, we can calculate the COP as follows:

COP = 10 kW / 2.5 kW

COP = 4

Therefore, the coefficient of performance (COP) of the heat pump is 4.
